shared_text:
WASHINGTONPOST.COM
Montessori, long a favorite for wealthy families, struggles to expand its reach

National Center for Montessori in the Public Sector
November 5, 2018 at 4:51 PM ·

This piece in the Washington Post does pretty well by Montessori: gets a lot of things right, doesn't get anything too far wrong, and highlights NCMPS demonstration school Breakthrough Montessori Public Charter School.

The article also features quotes from NCMPS E.D. Keith Whitescarver, NCMPS partners Mira Lutgendorf Debs (Education Studies Director at Yale) and Terry Ford (E.D. at Lumin Education), Breakthrough/NCMPS team member Allison Jones, and Breakthrough teacher Marissa Howser.

The Journal of Montessori Research (https://journals.ku.edu/jmr) and the Jeff Bezos announcement (http://www.montessoripublic.org/2018/10/amazons-jeff-bezos-pledges-blllions-for-montessori-inspired/) get mentions as well.

Here's the story:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/montessori-long-a-favorite-of-wealthy-families-struggles-to-expand-its-reach/2018/11/05/51a5ae02-ccc9-11e8-920f-dd52e1ae4570_story.html?utm_term=.0a8babfd96dc

(h/t Mira, where I saw it first!)

On Friday, February 2, over 30 interested funders, business leaders, elected officials, government officials, and community leaders visited our school to learn more about the Breakthrough model. The morning consisted of both classroom tours and panel discussions of the details of the model let by school leaders, teachers, and parents. Prior to the event, many of the guests had only a vague sense of what Montessori is. They left being both impressed and inspired with high fidelity Montessori.

Introducing a new member of the Breakthrough community, Delano Thomas Hedin.

Emily writes:

Adam and I are happy to share that our son Delano Thomas Hedin was born at 12:50 AM on Sunday, September 17, 2017.

Delano proved impatient to get started with life and was delivered by his mother and father in the car on the shoulder of Interstate 270. We made it to the hospital a few minutes later, where a medical team quickly determined that baby and mom were in perfect health. Delano (or Del, as we’ve begun to call him) weighed 6 pounds and 15 ounces and measured 19 inches long.

We have since learned that Interstate 270 was legislated under the presidency of Franklin Delano Roosevelt, so perhaps Del had a plan all along.

We are happy to be home with Del and are adjusting well to life as a family of three. Thank you to all our friends and family for your well wishes and support.

With love,
Emily, Adam and Del

No importa de qué origen sea – rico, pobre, urbano, rural – todos necesitan hablar sobre este asunto [de la educación]. Y eso es parte de nuestro reto – hacer que esta conversación sea lo suficientemente relevante para que esté en el centro de atención. En estos momentos estamos en medio de un debate presidencial y nadie realmente quiere hablar mucho sobre nuestro problema. Y, si lo hacen, no tienen idea de lo que están hablando.

Hacer esta conversación el centro de atención — nuestra comunidad necesita que se le haga esa llamada que los despierte y sacuda, diciéndoles lo que está pasando dentro de nuestras escuelas.
